docs.lead_paragraph: Cloud computing may be entering its next big test: Can the big players make lots of other people rich?
docs.abstract: The online storage company Box.net is introducing a developer network so companies can order custom-made software. It is the latest sign that cloud computing is becoming reliable and accepted by big business. Now the test is to see whether it can generate markets for thousands of outside software writers turning out stable and secure products.
docs.snippet: The online storage company Box.net is introducing a developer network so companies can order custom-made software. It is the latest sign that cloud computing is becoming reliable and accepted by big business. Now the test is to see whether it can...

docs.lead_paragraph: The justices should follow precedent, show restraint and uphold the constitutionality of health care reform.

headline.seo: Health Reform and the Supreme Court
headline.main: Health Reform and the Supreme Court
headline.print_headline: Health Reform and the Supreme Court

docs.abstract: Editorial urges the Supreme Court, which has agreed to hear a challenge to the 2010 Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act, to follow its own precedent, show judicial restraint and uphold the constitutionality of the health care reform law.
docs.snippet: The justices should follow precedent, show restraint and uphold the constitutionality of health care reform.

docs.lead_paragraph: No matter what the Supreme Court decides, health care in America has changed in ways that will not be easily undone.

headline.seo: Health Care Is Inexorably Changing, Despite Legal Uncertainty
headline.main: Whatever Court Rules, Major Changes in Health Care Likely to Last
headline.print_headline: Major Changes In Health Care Likely to Last

docs.abstract: Provisions of the national health care reform law that have been put into place since the act was adopted in 2010 are already well cemented and popular: these changes, including tougher oversight of health insurers and expansion of coverage to one million young adults, will not easily be undone no matter what the Supreme Court decides about the constitutionality of the law.
docs.snippet: No matter what the Supreme Court decides, health care in America has changed in ways that will not be easily undone.

keywords.name: subject

docs.lead_paragraph: Bright-light therapy is the treatment of choice for many Americans who suffer the winter blues, but many experts say it is underused.

headline.seo: Light Boxes May Help Melt Those Winter Blues
headline.main: A Portable Glow to Help Melt Those Winter Blues
headline.print_headline: A Portable Glow to Help Melt Those Winter Blues

docs.abstract: Roni Caryn Rabin The Consumer column suggests those who suffer from seasonal depression, known as Seasonal Affective Disorder, should try bright-light therapy, treatment that many doctors say is underused.
docs.snippet: Bright-light therapy is the treatment of choice for many Americans who suffer the winter blues, but many experts say it is underused.

docs.lead_paragraph: The justices agreed to hear a challenge to the 2010 health care overhaul law, setting the stage for a ruling in the midst of the 2012 presidential race.

headline.seo: Supreme Court to Hear Challenge to Health Care Law
headline.main: Justices to Hear Health Care Case as Race Heats Up
headline.print_headline: Justices to Hear Health Care Case As Race Heats Up

docs.abstract: Supreme Court agrees to hear a challenge to the 2010 health care reform law, Pres Obama's signature legislative achievement; decision sets the stage for a ruling in late June as the 2012 presidential campaign enters its crucial final months; whatever the outcome, the tensions running through the case are likely to give rise to both a political and constitutional blockbuster.
docs.snippet: The justices agreed to hear a challenge to the 2010 health care overhaul law, setting the stage for a ruling in the midst of the 2012 presidential race.
